original_title: Sri Lanka rupee trades stronger at 320.80/321.10 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened stronger at 320.80/321.10 to the US dollar on Tuesday from 322.20/40 on Monday, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2026, was quoted at 13.80/90 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 13.95/14.05 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2028 was quoted stable at 14.15/25 percent.
The Colombo Stock Exchange was trading up; the All Share Price Index was up 0.44 percent at 10,700, and the S&P SL20 was up 0.81 percent at 3,093 in mid-day trade. (Colombo/Jan2/2024)
